snippet: Lawsuits to overturn the Affordable Care Act are just desperate attempts to do in the courts what Republicans have failed to do in the political arena.
abstract: Editorial criticizes two long-shot lawsuits filed by conservative critics of Pres Obama's health care reform law; holds suits should be recognized as attempts to use courts to scuttle a law that Congressional Republicans have repeatedly tried and fail to repeal; urges Supreme Court to reject arguments in cases outright should they somehow reach the court.
lead_paragraph: Lawsuits to overturn the Affordable Care Act are just desperate attempts to do in the courts what Republicans have failed to do in the political arena.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
